page.title: 09Mc MULLEN'S BREWERY
page.content: The first Mc Mullen trade mark was designed in 1830.The firm owns well over a hundred pubs in the county.The greatest concentration is in Hertford,the seat of the business.In 1836 the first pub was opened in Bengeo,Hertford.The rapid growth meant that the brewery had to be moved to larger premises in Mill Bridge,which in turn became unable to cope with the demand.Then in 1891 ,the present brewery,sited over two wells which provide thosands of gallons of pure water, was moved to Hartham Lane,Hertford.Although the water supply plays an important part in the quality of the beer,the firm had to keep up the latest technological advantages.For many years re-equipment and expansion of production plant has gone on.Major new buildings have been erected.
